result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Pawlak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the DNA surcharge, costs, fees and disbursements.  
If revoked: monies to be taken  from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision. Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess firearms; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Parenting counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
Report date stayed to 9/9/15 by 5:00 p.m.
Huber for work.   Good time allowed.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Christopher A Pawlak in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requested an adjournment.  State had no objection.  Court granted defense request for ONE LAST adjournment and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.  File retained by the Court.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 633
cf
/filed.
/by the Parties, filed.

Defendant Christopher A Pawlak in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  Jay R. Pucek appeared on behalf of Franco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.   At the hour of 4:42 p.m., the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess firearms and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  No request for change in bail was made by the State.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and continued matter before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher A Pawlak in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled for the afternoon reporter. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of 1:35 p.m.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.   Court instructed jury.  Stipulation read into the record by the Court.  Opening statements by State and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Sgt.  Adam Riley,  Milwaukee Police Department; Deputy Shawn Bacich, Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Exhibits #1 thru #3 offered and received.  State rests.  Jury out of box.  Defense counsel's motion for directed verdict at the close of the State's case was argued and denied by the Court.   Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and his right not to not testify.  Defendant elects not to testify.  Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights to testifying.  Jury instructions gone over by the parties in court.  Jury back in box.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:14 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Steven Gunn and Joann Karczewski who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Christopher A Pawlak in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  Jay R. Pucek appeared on behalf of Franco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:53 a.m.  At the hour of 11:55 a.m., the Court excused jury panel for the noon hour with instructions to return by 1:30 p.m. in Room 113.  Jury panel out of box.  

Administrative strikes entered by the parties and placed on the record.  Court in recess for the noon hour.

Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: *.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of * to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies * who were duly sworn for that purpose.
